clinical_study.official_title: Telesimulation and Behavioral Health: Assessment of the Integration of the Abbreviated Checklist Contextual Interview Observation Form-Adult (CIOF-A) as a Learning Tool in Interprofessional Practice & Education: A Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Pacific Northwest University of Health Sciences

collaborator.agency: American Association of Colleges of Osteopathic Medicine - AACOM

clinical_study.source: Pacific Northwest University of Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This study proposes to assess attitudes, perceived proficiency, and knowledge related to telemedicine by implementing telesimulation behavioral health scenarios in a cohort of healthcare students using the Contextual Interview Observation Form.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Self-Efficacy in Patient Centeredness Questionnaire (SEPCQ27) 27-item
primary_outcome.description: The SEPCQ is designed to measure confidence levels at delivering patient-centered care (A 7-point Likert scale was used with "0" (to a very low degree) and "6" (To a very high degree)

arm_group.description: Face-to-Face Group: At the beginning of the session self-efficacy will be measured. This group will receive an instructor-led 45 minute long lecture on how to evaluate work, love, and play behavioral health form on a standardized patient. A face-to- face standardized patient scenario will test the participant on the application of work, love, and play assessment. In this scenario, the participant will meet a standardized patient in the exam room to discuss a behavioral health concern. At the end of each session (approximately 2 hours later), self-efficacy will be measured.

Robot Group: At the beginning of the session self-efficacy will be measured. This group will receive an instructor-led 45 minute long lecture on how to evaluate work, love, and play behavioral health form on a standardized patient. A robot (telesimulated) standardized patient scenario will test the participant on the application of work, love, and play assessment. In this scenario, the participant will meet a standardized patient in the exam room via a robot to discuss a behavioral health concern. At the end of each session (approximately 2 hours later), self-efficacy will be measured.

intervention.description: Use of a telesimulation robot using contextual interview format.
Use of face-to-face patient interview using contextual interview format.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any enrolled student at a participating program in the Yakima Valley Interprofessional Collaborative
- Age 18-33 (focusing on the Millennial Generation)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Able to read, write, and speak English due to the pilot nature of the study
- Have no pending litigation with any education entity within the YVIPEC
